page.title: 19FARMING IN FILKINS AREA cont
page.content: The two larger farms (both managed) farm sheep which are kept out in summer and brought in for winter lambing. Var- ieties include Border, Leicester and Cheviot cross with Suffolk rams. Betwe- en the two farms 730 lambs are produced annually. One farm has a dairy herd of 100 cows with 35 followers. They are kept loose in large sheds in the winter, free to roam. 1,300 tons of silage is fed to them over 200 days from beginning of September till mid-April. Another farm keeps 50 beefstock cattle outside to graze excess grass. There are 19 people working on these four farms, plus 4 students at harvest time. On one farm 8\ people work (the half, a part-time secretary). Many machines are used on the farms. Each has at least 1 combine harvester and 1 farm uses 5 landrovers & 4 tractors.
